sentences: Joshua Kit Clayton, better known by his stage name Kit Clayton, is a San Francisco-based electronic and digital musician and computer programmer.
He is a developer at San Francisco software company Cycling '74, helping create the Max/MSP MIDI/audio programming environment.
In 2000 Clayton founded and operated his own label, Orthlorng Musork.

Musork released seminal works by AGF, Akira Rabelais, Alejandra and Aeron, Kevin Blechdom, Blevin Blectum, Blectum from Blechdom, Eight Frozen Modules, Gold Chains, Secret Mommy, Stephan Mathieu, Sutekh, Timeblind, and others, until closing in 2004.
